role.descr: specific component in gene/RNA to get spliced // eg. extron, intron //
location referring to organelle, cell or tissue

example.text: Consequently, exon 30 with the intron is spliced.
example.fdg: 1 Consequently consequently @ADVL %EH ADV 2 , , 3 exon exon subj:>5 @SUBJ %NH N NOM SG 4 30 30 mod:>3 @6 @+FAUXV %AUX V PRES SG3 6 spliced splice main:>0 @-FMAINV %VP EN 7 together together meta:>6 @ADVL %EH ADV 8 with with com:>6 @ADVL %EH PREP 9 the the det:>10 @DN> %>N DET 10 intron intron pcomp:>8 @

example.text: The structure of different cDNA clones indicates that USF RNA is differentially spliced, and alternative exon usage may regulate the levels of functional USF protein.

1 The the det:>2 @DN> %>N DET 2 structure structure subj:>7 @SUBJ %NH N NOM SG 3 of of mod:>2 @5 @A> %>N A ABS 5 cDNA cdna attr:>6 @A> %>N ABBR NOM SG 6 clones clone pcomp:>3 @

example.text: The casp-2 minigene (C2) was spliced efficiently in vitro, and the ratio of casp-2S to casp-2L mRNAs produced was similar to the one observed in vivo (Fig.1 C, lane 1).

example.text: When incubated in nuclear extracts or transfected in HeLa cells, the C2Gloi2 substrate was spliced predominantly following the exon-skipping pathway to a level similar to that obtained with the C2 substrate (data not shown and Fig.2 E, compare lane 3 to lane 1).

example.text: An additional observation with the tandem repeat-containing 3? substrates was that the efficiency of bimolecular exon ligation decreased stepwise with each mutation that moved the 5?-most AG 6 nt further downstream such that RNA 3I spliced only 20% as efficiently as RNA 3F (Fig.1 C Left).

example.text: The pre-mRNAs from all of these genes are spliced with little or no exon-skipping (ref.16; also Fig.1 C and data not shown), suggesting that correct exon inclusion can be managed by the yeast gene expression machinery.
example.arg: The pre-mRNAs from all of these genes

example.text: However, a pre-mRNA containing mutations in SE2 is spliced predominantly using the nt 3605 3' splice site.

example.text: Vertebrate internal exons are usually between 50 and 400 nt long; exons outside this size range may require additional exonic and/or intronic sequences to be spliced into the mature mRNA.
example.fdg:
1 Vertebrate vertebrate attr:>2 @A> %>N N NOM SG 2 internal internal attr:>3 @A> %>N A ABS 3 exons exon subj:>4 @SUBJ %NH N NOM PL 4 are be main:>0 @+FMAINV %VA V PRES 5 usually usually man:>4 @ADVL %EH ADV 6 between between ha:>4 @ADVL %EH PREP 7 50 50 pcomp:>6 @
